com.mumfrey.liteloader.transformers.event

Class Event

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mumfrey.liteloader.transformers.event.Event
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Event>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    PacketEvent

    public class Event
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Event>
    An injectable "event". An event is like a regular callback except that it is more intelligent about where it can be injected in the bytecode and also supports conditional "cancellation", which is the ability to conditionally return from the containing method with a custom return value.
    Author:
    Adam Mummery-Smith

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected boolean cancellable
      Whether this event is cancellable - if it is cancellable then the isCancelled() -> RETURN code will be injected.
      protected java.lang.String eventDescriptor
      Descriptor for this event in the context of the attached method
      protected java.lang.String eventInfoClass 
      protected MethodNode method
      Method this event is currently "attached" to, we "attach" at the beginning of a method injection in order to save recalculating things like the return type and descriptor for each invocation, this means we need to calculate these things at most once for each method this event is injecting into.
      protected boolean methodIsStatic
      True if the attached method is static, used so that we know whether to push "this" onto the stack when constructing the EventInfo, or "null"
      protected int methodMAXS
      Method's original MAXS, used as a base to work out whether we need to increase the MAXS value.
      protected Type methodReturnType
      Return type for the attached method, used to determine which EventInfo class to use and which method to invoke.
      protected java.lang.String name
      The name of this event
      protected java.util.Set<MethodInfo> pendingInjections 
      protected boolean verbose

    • Field Detail

      • name

        protected final java.lang.String name
        The name of this event

      • cancellable

        protected final boolean cancellable
        Whether this event is cancellable - if it is cancellable then the isCancelled() -> RETURN code will be injected.

      • method

        protected MethodNode method
        Method this event is currently "attached" to, we "attach" at the beginning of a method injection in order to save recalculating things like the return type and descriptor for each invocation, this means we need to calculate these things at most once for each method this event is injecting into.

      • eventDescriptor

        protected java.lang.String eventDescriptor
        Descriptor for this event in the context of the attached method

      • methodMAXS

        protected int methodMAXS
        Method's original MAXS, used as a base to work out whether we need to increase the MAXS value.

      • methodIsStatic

        protected boolean methodIsStatic
        True if the attached method is static, used so that we know whether to push "this" onto the stack when constructing the EventInfo, or "null"

      • methodReturnType

        protected Type methodReturnType
        Return type for the attached method, used to determine which EventInfo class to use and which method to invoke.

      • eventInfoClass

        protected java.lang.String eventInfoClass

      • pendingInjections

        protected java.util.Set<MethodInfo> pendingInjections

      • verbose

        protected boolean verbose

      • getOrCreate

        public static Event getOrCreate(java.lang.String name)
        Creates a new event with the specified name, if an event with the specified name already exists then the existing event is returned instead.
        Parameters:
        name - Event name (case insensitive)
        Returns:
        new Event instance or existing Event instance

      • getOrCreate

        public static Event getOrCreate(java.lang.String name,
                                boolean cancellable)
        Creates a new event with the specified name, if an event with the specified name already exists then the existing event is returned instead.
        Parameters:
        name - Event name (case insensitive)
        cancellable - True if the event should be created as cancellable
        Returns:
        new Event instance or existing Event instance

      • getOrCreate

        public static Event getOrCreate(java.lang.String name,
                                boolean cancellable,
                                int priority)
        Creates a new event with the specified name, if an event with the specified name already exists then the existing event is returned instead.
        Parameters:
        name - Event name (case insensitive)
        cancellable - True if the event should be created as cancellable
        priority - Priority for the event, only used when multiple events are being injected at the same instruction
        Returns:
        new Event instance or existing Event instance
